Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2007 05:56PM RICHARDZON wrote: 14 years ago I had a right side mastectomy with immediate reconstruction (latissimus dorsi flap) for microscopic pinprick sized calcifications. First I went through 2 partial mastectomies to try to get clean margins. I had the surgery done in Boston and it met my goal of looking normal in clothes. Now I have the same issue with my left breast, but I am looking at having the work done closer to my home in NH rather than traveling to Boston as I did before. My doctors are no longer there anyway. At first I was going to do a partial, but decided I didn't want to take the time to heal, only to do it again, and I didn't want to look like I had part of the stuffing taken out of me. So I will do a modified radical mastectomy. I am really concerned that it will not look or feel the same. I was told my saline implant would last 10 years or so. I would like to replace it when they do the other. My surgeon dodges any mention of a plastic surgeon and wants to schedule surgery. I feel I have to know which method will be used for immediate reconstruction and feel they should know also, having been through this before. So I set up my own appointment with a plastic surgeon. I don't know what to tell my employer about how long I will be out of work (I am a part-time temp and don't want to lose this job I've been doing for 4 years). I still have to meet with 3 doctors. Last time I dealt with all female doctors, this time they are all male. I want to stand up for myself but sometimes I get in the office and melt. I guess I want to know if anyone else has had mastectomy reconstruction followed many years later with another and how the reconstruction was done to balance the look. Thank you for listening.
